intro: Hymenopappus fisheri, commonly known as the desert gumplant, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive bracts. The plant has gray-green, woolly leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with pale pink or white ray florets. Hymenopappus fisheri is adapted to survive in sandy soils and can withstand extreme temperatures and drought conditions.
